name: Mathematical Modelling for Commons
short_description:
Mathematical Moddeling for Commons is an infrastructure [in development] that will enable you to: 
(i) create a mathematical model of your problem,
(ii) verify boundary constraints of your problem,
(iii) enter relationship between variables of your problem,
(iv) collaborate with your peers in the process of model creation,
(v) publish the resulting problem as a web form, mobile application, and web service.

By design, the infrastructure is initially built for schooling youth, mainly high school or even advanced final classes of elementary school, who can use it in their research projects. Our aim is to support introduction of problem based learning into the courses of mathematics and natural sciences, where closed-form problems are dominating the curriculum, and to allow schooling youth to bring their knowledge outside of the classroom, thus building their carrer network.

The project is in development and is expected to launch in spring 2015. Your comments are wellcome.
summary: We help you create and publish mathematical models.
